intro: Thesium bergeri, commonly known as the desert star, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa, particularly Namibia and South Africa. The plant is characterized by its distinctive yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. It has a low-growing, mat-forming habit with narrow, grass-like leaves. Thesium bergeri is well adapted to harsh, dry environments and is often found in sandy or rocky soils.
